result.execSummary:
The defendant Stevie L. Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stevie L. Perez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Refer Debt to the WI Dept of Revenue, along with supporting Reminder Notices.

Case called at 2:52pm [mo]
Defendant Stevie L. Perez in court, in custody with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Counsel verify receipt of Revocation Order and Warrant, 
--ADA Teuber raises to the Court that the recommendation made by the Agent differ on the cover page and document, and exceed the maximum penalty. 
--ADA Teuber notes a date correction
--Atty. Svehlek agrees with needed correction
--The Court agrees on corrections

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

On Count #1 the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 7 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; this sentence is to commence FORTHWITH and is to be served concurrent to current sentence in being in case 15CF284. 

On Count #2 the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to be served concurrent to the sentence in Count #1 and the sentence in case 15CF284

--55 days credit for time already served given

--Ms. Perez is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

The Court orders that all outstanding financial obligations be converted to civil judgement.
recess: 3:12pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 12-22-2015 02:30 pm

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 13CM262 & 14CF210 called together at 3:04 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Stevie L. Perez in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court strikes domestic abuse repeater enhancer on Counts #1 & #2

14CF210: Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1 & #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

On Counts #1 & #2, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment (within 90 days) & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Domestic violence counseling or Batterer's Intervention, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--Contact with Jeremy Rose only if both he and Agent agree
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol
 or illegal drugs
--No acts/threats of violence towards any persons
--To pay costs of $
486 ($243 each count) 
--To pay $400 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)
--To pay $200 domestic abuse surcharge ($100 each count)

Days credit for time already served: 35 days
Court orders Ms. Perez to report to Probation Office by close of business 9/29/14

On Counts #1 & #2-13CM262, the Court sentences the Defendant to
--serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail, each count, concurrent, with Huber/Work-release privileges

Counts #1 & #2, the Court orders Ms. Perez to pay remaining court costs of $686; due in $35 increments per month beginning 10/31/14 and on the last day of the month thereafter until paid in full. Failure to pay results in 28 days jail with Huber, consecutive

-- 68 days credit given for time served
TIME SERVED SENTENCE
Recess: 3:35 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 25, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Proposed stip and order for continuance
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Case called at 11:06 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Stevie L. Perez in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek: Requests matter be set for plea/sentencing in approx. 3 weeks. If receive a revocation order and warrant on another matter, would request the Court schedule the revocation hearing at the same date and time.
DA Happ: No objection, suggests setting matter out 30 days as paperwork may not be complete in 3 weeks

NEXT: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing 9/26/14 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
Status conference on August 29, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Case called at10:41 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Stevie L. Perez in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Perez waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending

NEXT: (1) STC scheduled for 8/29/14 at 11:00 am - Send notices
Status conference on July 25, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 9, 2014 at 09:20 am.

[KG]
Case called at 1:22 pm.  

Defendant Stevie L. Perez in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Attorney Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Court reviews Conflict Review Worksheet. The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Ms. Perez. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed. Court finds no conflict and signs the Conflict Review Worksheet. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited.
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct. 
Court has reviewed the Criminal Complaint and finds that it states Probable Cause to support Counts #1 and #2.
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the video connection is sight and sound sufficient.

Court requires $1,500 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with Jeremy Rose 

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties. 

Recess: 1:35 pm

NEXT: 
PTC- 7-9-14 at 9:20 am
Status- 7-25-14 at 10:30 am
